summary.span: 为 使用的绑定算法提供基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for binding algorithms used by .

param.name: context
param.span: 元数据加载上下文对象，表示为仅供检查目的而加载的 对象的封闭范围。

span.span: The metadata load context object that represents the closed universe of objects loaded for inspection-only purposes.

summary.span: 根据给定程序集名称返回程序集。

span.span: Returns an assembly from a given assembly name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当 调用时或一个程序集中的某个类型依赖于其他程序集时，将会将程序集名称绑定到程序集。Binding an assembly name to an assembly occurs when is called or when a type from one assembly has a dependency on another assembly. 重写应使用的处理程序 `Resolve` ， 或 加载请求的程序集并返回它。The handler that overrides `Resolve` should use , or to load the requested assembly and return it. 若要指示未能找到程序集，处理程序应返回， `null` 而不是引发异常。To indicate the failure to find an assembly, the handler should return `null` rather than throwing an exception. 返回 `null` 会提交失败，以便将来尝试加载该名称失败，而不会重新调用处理程序。Returning `null` commits the failure so that future attempts to load that name will fail without re-invoking the handler. 如果处理程序引发异常，则该异常将传递到调用触发绑定的操作的应用程序。If the handler throws an exception, the exception will be passed through to the application that invoked the operation that triggered the binding. 不会捕获它，并且不会进行任何绑定。The will not catch it, and no binding will occur. 通常，对于同一名称，处理程序将不会被调用一次，除非两个线程争用加载同一程序集。The handler will generally not be called more than once for the same name, unless two threads race to load the same assembly. 即使在这种情况下，结果也会入选，并以原子方式绑定到名称。Even in that case, one result will win and be atomically bound to the name. 特意不在返回的程序集上执行任何引用匹配，因为构成了引用定义的匹配项是策略。The intentionally performs no ref-def matching on the returned assembly as what constitutes a ref-def match is a policy. 它也是一种尽力避免的任意限制 。It is also the kind of arbitrary restriction that strives to avoid. 不能使用其他元数据加载上下文中的程序集，也不能使用其他类型提供程序 (例如，基础运行时自身的反射系统) 。The cannot consume assemblies from other metadata load contexts or other type providers (such as the underlying runtime's own reflection system). 如果处理程序返回此类程序集，则会 引发 。If a handler returns such an assembly, the throws a .
